block.label: Logistics

radio.label: Location
radio.title: Sample Source (web) / Location (web to clt)
radio.row: Oi Research- Online Interactive Research Limited

text.label: LocationCode
text.title: This is used to assign each location's unique identifying code from the Location question row label. Do not edit.

block.note: Edit logic based on country - if one country, use "True", if multiple countries, assign based on sample company. Make sure field department knows to alert you if they are adding a sample company

p.b:
HELLO AND WELCOME TO OUR SURVEY!
YOUR OPINIONS ARE VERY IMPORTANT TO US AND THANK YOU IN ADVANCE FOR YOUR PARTICIPATION.
PLEASE ANSWER EACH QUESTION CAREFULLY AND COMPLETELY. REMEMBER THERE ARE NO RIGHT OR WRONG ANSWERS.
USE THE SCROLL BAR ON THE RIGHT AND BOTTOM OF YOUR SCREEN TO MOVE UP AND DOWN THROUGH QUESTIONS AND IMAGES.
LET’S BEGIN…

block.label: Screener

radio.label: S_Gender
radio.title: Which of the following best describes how you identify?

text.label: SelfIdentifyGender_OE
text.title:
Please describe your identity below:
Prefer to self-identify (Please specify)

checkbox.label: S_Industry
checkbox.title: Do you or does anyone in your family work for or have ever worked for any of the following companies or industries?
checkbox.row: A marketing or research department of a company (including in-store sampling firms/promotional agencies, etc.)
Advertising agency or Public relations firm
Physical Retail or Online Retail store, such as a drugstore, grocery store, Walmart or Target
A graphic or packaging design firm
State, local, or federal government agency
A manufacturer, sells, or distributes, medications, vitamins, minerals, or dietary supplements
Medical Profession, such as a doctor, nurse, dentist, pharmacist, nutritionist/dietician,
Chiropractor, acupuncturist, herbalist, physiotherapist, personal trainer, holistic/alternative health practitioner or psychologist

checkbox.label: S_Condition
checkbox.title: Which, if any, of the following conditions do you currently suffer from on a regular basis

checkbox.label: S_Remedy
checkbox.title: Which of the following remedies, if any, have you purchased and used in the past 3 months to treat your Muscle or Joint Pain?
checkbox.row: Non-prescription pain relief pills (i.e. Advil, Tylenol)
Topical creams / ointments for pain relief
Visit a Chiropractor or Physical Therapist
Non-medicated pain relieving devices (to purchase and use at home)
I don't currently treat my muscle or joint pain.

checkbox.label: S_Remedy_Open
checkbox.title: Which of the following remedies would you be open to using in the future?
checkbox.row: Non-prescription pain relief pills (i.e. Advil, Tylenol)
Topical creams / ointments for pain relief
Visit a Chiropractor or Physical Therapist
Non-medicated pain relieving devices (to purchase and use at home)
I don't currently treat my knee and/or back pain.

radio.label: S_PAIN
radio.title: Which of the following statements best describes the muscle or joint pain you’ve been experiencing?
radio.row: Occasional or episodic muscle/joint pain or soreness
Recurring or consistent muscle/joint pain and soreness that has lasted more than 3 months in the same location

radio.label: S_Pain_Statement
radio.title: Please read the list of statements and select to what extent you agree or disagree with each regarding the pain you suffer from.
radio.comment: Select one response for each statement.
radio.row: My pain episodes have become more frequent over the last 3 months.
My pain has become more severe over the last 3 months.
I have used more over-the-counter products (internal and external pain relief) in the last 3 months than the prior 3 months.

checkbox.label: S_Pain_Cause
checkbox.title: Please read this list of potential causes of pain and please indicate all that you suffer from.
checkbox.row: Heavy activity related to occupation/service e.g., military, fire fighters, delivery personnel, etc.
Old injury to a joint or muscle
Stress and tension from daily life

radio.label: S_ChannelShopper
radio.title: Where do you purchase your external pain relief (Topical creams, ointments, sprays, patches...etc.) most often?
radio.row: In a physical store and online

block.exec: if hasMarker("/quotaChannelShopper/instore"): ChannelShopper.val = 0 if hasMarker("/quotaChannelShopper/online"): ChannelShopper.val = 1

radio.label: ChannelShopper
radio.title: ChannelShopper

autofill.label: S_ChannelShopper_pipe
autofill.title: S_ChannelShopper
autofill.row: either for delivery or to pick-up in store

radio.label: S_Pain_Shop
radio.title: How much of the shopping for external pain relief (Topical creams, ointments, sprays, patches...etc.) do you do for yourself?
radio.row: I do most of the shopping for myself
I do half of the shopping for myself
I do less than half of the shopping for myself

checkbox.label: S_Typical10InStore
checkbox.title: When you purchase external pain relief from a physical store, which of the following do you purchase from?

radio.label: S_Typical10MostInStore
radio.title: When you purchase external pain relief in a physical store, which do you purchase from most often?

radio.label: S_ExternalPain_Delivery
radio.title: When you purchase external pain relief online, how do you elect to receive it most often?
radio.row: I pick it up in-store or curbside
I have it shipped to my house
Third party app/service to bring it to my house the same day I order it.

checkbox.label: S_Typical10CCOnline
checkbox.title: When you purchase external pain relief online and go to the store to pick it up, which store / website do you purchase from?

radio.label: S_Typical10MostCCOnline
radio.title: When you purchase external pain relief online and go to the store to pick it up , which do you purchase from most often?

checkbox.label: S_typical10SHOnline
checkbox.title: When you purchase external pain relief online and ask to ship it to your home, which website do you purchase from?

radio.label: S_Typical10MostSHOnline
radio.title: When you purchase external pain relief and ask to ship it to your home, which website do you purchase from most often?

term.label: TERM_S_Typical10MostSHOnline
term.cond: S_Typical10MostSHOnline.r9 or S_Typical10MostSHOnline.r10 or S_Typical10MostSHOnline.r11 or S_Typical10MostSHOnline.r98

row.label: r2
row.autofill: S_Typical10Most.r3 or S_Typical10Most.r4 or S_Typical10Most.r5 or S_Typical10Most.r6 or S_Typical10Most.r7

select.label: S_Employment
select.title: What is your current employment status?

select.label: S_Income
select.title: What is your total annual household income?

radio.label: S_Presence_of_Children
radio.title: Are there any children of yours living in your household who are 17 years of age or younger?

radio.label: S_Number_of_Children
radio.title: How many children live in your household?

checkbox.label: S_Children_Age
checkbox.title: How old are the children living in your household?

radio.label: S_Number_of_Adults
radio.title: How many adults, including yourself, live in your household?

survey.exec:
p.household_size = 0
if S_Number_of_Adults.any: p.household_size = p.household_size + (S_Number_of_Adults.val + 1) if S_Number_of_Children.any: p.household_size = p.household_size + (S_Number_of_Children.val + 1)
if p.household_size == 1: if S_Income.ch1: Income_Level.val = 0 if S_Income.ch2 or S_Income.ch3 or S_Income.ch4 or S_Income.ch5 or S_Income.ch6: Income_Level.val = 1 if S_Income.ch7 or S_Income.ch8 or S_Income.ch9 or S_Income.ch10 or S_Income.ch11: Income_Level.val = 2
if p.household_size == 2: if S_Income.ch1 or S_Income.ch2: Income_Level.val = 0 if S_Income.ch3 or S_Income.ch4 or S_Income.ch5 or S_Income.ch6: Income_Level.val = 1 if S_Income.ch7 or S_Income.ch8 or S_Income.ch9 or S_Income.ch10 or S_Income.ch11: Income_Level.val = 2
if p.household_size == 3: if S_Income.ch1 or S_Income.ch2 or S_Income.ch3: Income_Level.val = 0 if S_Income.ch4 or S_Income.ch5 or S_Income.ch6 or S_Income.ch7: Income_Level.val = 1 if S_Income.ch8 or S_Income.ch9 or S_Income.ch10 or S_Income.ch11: Income_Level.val = 2
if p.household_size == 4: if S_Income.ch1 or S_Income.ch2 or S_Income.ch3 or S_Income.ch4: Income_Level.val = 0 if S_Income.ch5 or S_Income.ch6 or S_Income.ch7: Income_Level.val = 1 if S_Income.ch8 or S_Income.ch9 or S_Income.ch10 or S_Income.ch11: Income_Level.val = 2
if p.household_size == 5: if S_Income.ch1 or S_Income.ch2 or S_Income.ch3 or S_Income.ch4 or S_Income.ch5: Income_Level.val = 0 if S_Income.ch6 or S_Income.ch7 or S_Income.ch8: Income_Level.val = 1 if S_Income.ch9 or S_Income.ch10 or S_Income.ch11: Income_Level.val = 2
if p.household_size ge 6: if S_Income.ch1 or S_Income.ch2 or S_Income.ch3 or S_Income.ch4 or S_Income.ch5 or S_Income.ch6: Income_Level.val = 0 if S_Income.ch7 or S_Income.ch8: Income_Level.val = 1 if S_Income.ch9 or S_Income.ch10 or S_Income.ch11: Income_Level.val = 2

radio.label: Income_Level
radio.title: Combine HH size with Income

survey.html:
For the next set of questions, please think about when you last bought external pain relief products from a retailer [pipe:S_ChannelShopper_pipe] .
But before we get started, please tell us a little bit about the brands you know and use.

define.label: Usage_ExternalPain_Aware_list
define.builder:title: Usage_ExternalPain_Aware list
define.row: Generic or store brand external pain relief

checkbox.label: Usage_ExternalPain_Aware
checkbox.title: Which of the following brand(s) of external pain relief product are you aware of?

checkbox.label: Usage_ExternalPain_BOUGHT
checkbox.title: Which of the following brand(s) of external pain relief product have you purchased in the past 12 months for you personally?

checkbox.label: Usage_ExternalPain_BOUGHT_KID
checkbox.title: Which of the following brand(s) of external pain relief product have you purchased in the past 12 months for your child or children?

radio.label: Usage_ExternalPain_TYPICALLY_USE
radio.title: Which brand of external pain relief product do you typically use to treat your external pain?

radio.label: Usage_ExternalPain_TYPICALLY_USE_KID
radio.title: Which brand of external pain relief product do your child/children typically use to treat external pain?

checkbox.label: S_Brand_Rejector
checkbox.title: Which of the following brands of pain relievers would you NOT consider purchasing and using in the future?
checkbox.row: I would consider purchasing any of these brands in the future
I would not purchase any of these brands in the future

radio.label: S_Brand_Feeling
radio.title: Thinking about each of the brands of pain reliever you see below. Please tell me which statement best matches how you feel about each brand.
radio.comment: Please select one response for each brand.
radio.row: It is the only brand of pain reliever I use.
It is almost always the first brand I consider, but I also use others.
It is one of my favorite brands along with others.
It is a brand I use, but there are others I would consider before this one.
I don't typically use this brand but would be open to using it.
I have tried this brand, but I wouldn't use it again.
I have never tried this brand and never will.
It is a brand I would recommend to other people.

survey.html: Great! For the next set of questions, please now think about when you last bought external pain relief from a retailer [pipe:S_ChannelShopper_pipe].

radio.label: Q_SHOP1
radio.title: Thinking about the most recent time you bought external pain relief products from a retailer [pipe:S_ChannelShopper_pipe], when did you decide to buy it?

radio.label: Q_SHOP2
radio.title: Did you do any research before deciding to buy external pain relief products from a retailer [pipe:S_ChannelShopper_pipe]?

checkbox.label: Q_SHOP_2A
checkbox.title: When did you conduct research for external pain relief products to buy from a retailer [pipe:S_ChannelShopper_pipe]?
checkbox.row: At the store by looking at available products on the shelves
On my mobile phone while at the store
Online while at home or another place (not at a store)

checkbox.label: Q_SHOP3
checkbox.title: Which of these sources of did you use to do research for external pain relief products to buy from a retailer [pipe:S_ChannelShopper_pipe]?
checkbox.row: Recommendation from an expert (in-store associate, pharmacist, etc.)
Recommendation from a coach, trainer, or exercise/sports professional
Recommendation from influencers (e.g. content creators on Instagram or Youtube.com)
On social media (e.g., Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, TikTok, etc.)
Online review and information websites and articles (e.g., WebMD.com, Mayoclinic.com, etc.)
Online groups and discussion boards (e.g., reddit)

radio.label: Q_SHOP4
radio.title: Who/what do you TRUST MOST when researching/learning about external pain relief products to buy from a retailer [pipe:S_ChannelShopper_pipe]?
radio.row: Recommendation from an expert (in-store associate, pharmacist, etc.)
Recommendation from a coach, trainer, or exercise/sports professional
Recommendation from influencers (e.g. content creators on Instagram or Youtube.com)
On social media (e.g., Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, TikTok, etc.)
Online review and information websites and articles (e.g., WebMD.com, Mayoclinic.com, etc.)
Online groups and discussion boards (e.g., reddit)

block.label: block_Conjoint
block.exec: Q15_dcm = setupDCMFile("DCM_design.dat")

autofill.label: S_ChannelShopper_DCM
autofill.title: S_ChannelShopper
autofill.row: In this section we would like you to imagine you are about to buy external pain relief products at a retailer in-store. You will see a range of different offers presented - each time at a different price. Please select the offer that you would buy.

In this section we would like you to imagine you are about to buy external pain relief products at a retailer online. You will see a range of different offers presented - each time at a different price. Please select the offer that you would buy.

block.exec: p.startTime = timeSpent()

block.label: Q15_dcm_block
block.exec: setupDCMItems( Q15_dcm, "v%s_t%s" % (hidVersion.val,"[loopvar: task]"),"[loopvar: task]", "Q15") p.DCMcount = "%d" % (Q15_dcm_loop_expanded.order.index([loopvar: task]-1) + 1)

text.label: progAttr_[loopvar: task]
text.title: Programming to punch attributes for rows

radio.label: hidAttribute1_[loopvar: task]
radio.title: Hidden to punch attributes displayed

radio.label: hidAttribute2_[loopvar: task]
radio.title: Hidden to punch attributes displayed

radio.title: Hidden to punch attributes displayed

radio.title: Hidden to punch attributes displayed

radio.title: Hidden to punch attributes displayed

radio.label: Q_Decision_Categories_[loopvar: task]

noanswer.label: n99
noanswer.div: None, I would not choose any of these

block.label: ConsiderationFactors_online
block.builder:title: Question – ConsiderationFactors_online
block.exec:
VersionMD_temp = str(Q_DecisionFactorsO_Version.val)
fileOject = open(gv.survey.path+"/ConsiderationFactors_MaxDiff_Design_O.dat","r") try: fileList = fileOject.readlines() finally: fileOject.close()
p.fileFound = 0
for line in fileList[1:]: thisLine = line.strip('\r\n').split("\t") for x in range(1,19): if VersionMD_temp == thisLine[0] and thisLine[1] == str(x): eval("Version_Set_O"+str(x)+".r1").val=thisLine[2] eval("Version_Set_O"+str(x)+".r2").val=thisLine[3] eval("Version_Set_O"+str(x)+".r3").val=thisLine[4] eval("Version_Set_O"+str(x)+".r4").val=thisLine[5] eval("Version_Set_O"+str(x)+".r5").val=thisLine[6]

setOrder1 = [] setOrder2 = [] setOrder3 = [] setOrder4 = [] setOrder5 = [] setOrder6 = [] setOrder7 = [] setOrder8 = [] setOrder9 = [] setOrder10 = [] setOrder11 = [] setOrder12 = [] setOrder13 = [] setOrder14 = [] setOrder15 = []
for x in range(1,16): for y in eval("Q_DecisionFactorsO_"+str(x)).rows: y.disabled=1
for x in range(1,16): for z in eval("Version_Set_O"+str(x)).rows: print z.val print int(z.val)-1 eval("Q_DecisionFactorsO_"+str(x)).rows[int(z.val)-1].disabled = 0 eval("setOrder"+str(x)).append(int(z.val)-1) eval("Q_DecisionFactorsO_"+str(x)).rows.order = eval("setOrder"+str(x)) dataorder=[] for sorder in eval("setOrder"+str(x)): dataorder.append(str(sorder+1)) eval("list_order_O_"+str(x)).val= ",".join(dataorder) print eval("Q_DecisionFactorsO_"+str(x)).rows.order
p.startTime = timeSpent()
p.navText=1

define.label: MD_list_O
define.builder:title: MD list
define.row: Topical cream, gel, lotion or oil
Good for muscle pain, spasms, and tension
Good for joints (ankle, knee, wrist, neck, elbow, hip, back and shoulder)
Multi-Pack Bundle (i.e., pack of 2, pack of 4, etc.)
It was on my shopping list
WOM (word of mouth); Recommendation by friend
Strength (Regular, Ultra, Maximum, professional, prescription, etc.)

block.label: Q_DecisionFactorsO_md_block

radio.label: Q_DecisionFactorsO_[loopvar: task]
radio.title:
Thinking about when you were buying external pain relief from a retailer [pipe:S_ChannelShopper_pipe], which factors were most and least important to your decision?
In this exercise you will see several different sets of five factors each. Some factors may get repeated over different sets. For each set, please select the factors that are most important and least important to you in that set.

float.label: SC_MaxDiff_O_[loopvar: task]
float.title: For each task, all alternatives need a variable (i.e. 11 variables per task in this design). Each statement is coded as follows: Code 1 = most encouraging alternative Code 0 = alternative shown, but not selected Code -1 = least encouraging alternative Code SYSMIS (i.e. missing value) = alternative not shown

block.exec: p.navText=p.navText+1

select.label: Q_DecisionFactorsO_BEFORE
select.title: BEFORE you started shopping, what were you going to look for?

select.label: Q_DecisionFactorsO_COMPARE
select.title: When you were CHOOSING AND COMPARING among different products while shopping, what did you pay attention to most?

checkbox.label: Q_DecisionFactorsO_BEFORE_Top3
checkbox.title: Top3 BEFORE you started shopping, what were you going to look for?

checkbox.label: Q_DecisionFactorsO_COMPARE_Top3
checkbox.title: Top3 When you were CHOOSING AND COMPARING among different products while shopping, what did you pay attention to most?

checkbox.label: Q_DecisionFactorsO_CHOICE_Top3
checkbox.title: Top3 What influenced your FINAL CHOICE?

checkbox.label: Q_DecisionFactorsO_BEFORE_Top2
checkbox.title: Top2 BEFORE you started shopping, what were you going to look for?

checkbox.label: Q_DecisionFactorsO_COMPARE_Top2
checkbox.title: Top2 When you were CHOOSING AND COMPARING among different products while shopping, what did you pay attention to most?

checkbox.label: Q_DecisionFactorsO_CHOICE_Top2
checkbox.title: Top2 What influenced your FINAL CHOICE?

block.label: ConsiderationFactors_IS
block.builder:title: Question – ConsiderationFactors_IS
block.exec:
VersionMD_temp = str(Q_DecisionFactorsIS_Version.val)
fileOject = open(gv.survey.path+"/ConsiderationFactors_MaxDiff_Design_IS.dat","r") try: fileList = fileOject.readlines() finally: fileOject.close()
p.fileFound = 0
for line in fileList[1:]: thisLine = line.strip('\r\n').split("\t") for x in range(1,16): if VersionMD_temp == thisLine[0] and thisLine[1] == str(x): eval("Version_Set_IS"+str(x)+".r1").val=thisLine[2] eval("Version_Set_IS"+str(x)+".r2").val=thisLine[3] eval("Version_Set_IS"+str(x)+".r3").val=thisLine[4] eval("Version_Set_IS"+str(x)+".r4").val=thisLine[5] eval("Version_Set_IS"+str(x)+".r5").val=thisLine[6]

setOrder1 = [] setOrder2 = [] setOrder3 = [] setOrder4 = [] setOrder5 = [] setOrder6 = [] setOrder7 = [] setOrder8 = [] setOrder9 = [] setOrder10 = [] setOrder11 = [] setOrder12 = [] setOrder13 = [] setOrder14 = [] setOrder15 = []
for x in range(1,16): for y in eval("Q_DecisionFactorsIS_"+str(x)).rows: y.disabled=1
for x in range(1,16): for z in eval("Version_Set_IS"+str(x)).rows: print z.val print int(z.val)-1 eval("Q_DecisionFactorsIS_"+str(x)).rows[int(z.val)-1].disabled = 0 eval("setOrder"+str(x)).append(int(z.val)-1) eval("Q_DecisionFactorsIS_"+str(x)).rows.order = eval("setOrder"+str(x)) dataorder=[] for sorder in eval("setOrder"+str(x)): dataorder.append(str(sorder+1)) eval("list_ISrder_IS_"+str(x)).val= ",".join(dataorder) print eval("Q_DecisionFactorsIS_"+str(x)).rows.order
p.startTime = timeSpent()
p.navText=1

define.label: MD_list_IS
define.builder:title: MD list
define.row: Topical cream, gel, lotion or oil
Good for muscle pain, spasms, and tension
Good for joints (ankle, knee, wrist, neck, elbow, hip, back and shoulder)
It was on my shopping list
WOM (word of mouth); Recommendation by friend
Strength (Regular, Ultra, Maximum, professional, prescription, etc.)

block.label: Q_DecisionFactorsIS_md_block

radio.label: Q_DecisionFactorsIS_[loopvar: task]
radio.title:
Thinking about when you were buying external pain relief from a retailer [pipe:S_ChannelShopper_pipe], which factors were most and least important to your decision?
In this exercise you will see several different sets of five factors each. Some factors may get repeated over different sets. For each set, please select the factors that are most important and least important to you in that set.

float.label: SC_MaxDiff_IS_[loopvar: task]
float.title: For each task, all alternatives need a variable (i.e. 11 variables per task in this design). Each statement is coded as follows: Code 1 = most encouraging alternative Code 0 = alternative shown, but not selected Code -1 = least encouraging alternative Code SYSMIS (i.e. missing value) = alternative not shown

block.exec: p.navText=p.navText+1

select.label: Q_DecisionFactorsIS_BEFORE
select.title: BEFORE you started shopping, what were you going to look for?

select.label: Q_DecisionFactorsIS_COMPARE
select.title: When you were CHOOSING AND COMPARING among different products while shopping, what did you pay attention to most?

checkbox.label: Q_DecisionFactorsIS_BEFORE_Top3
checkbox.title: Top3 BEFORE you started shopping, what were you going to look for?

checkbox.label: Q_DecisionFactorsIS_COMPARE_Top3
checkbox.title: Top3 When you were CHOOSING AND COMPARING among different products while shopping, what did you pay attention to most?

checkbox.label: Q_DecisionFactorsIS_CHOICE_Top3
checkbox.title: Top3 What influenced your FINAL CHOICE?

checkbox.label: Q_DecisionFactorsIS_BEFORE_Top2
checkbox.title: Top2 BEFORE you started shopping, what were you going to look for?

checkbox.label: Q_DecisionFactorsIS_COMPARE_Top2
checkbox.title: Top2 When you were CHOOSING AND COMPARING among different products while shopping, what did you pay attention to most?

checkbox.label: Q_DecisionFactorsIS_CHOICE_Top2
checkbox.title: Top2 What influenced your FINAL CHOICE?

checkbox.label: Q_Triggers
checkbox.title: Thinking about the last time you purchased external pain relief products at a retailer [pipe:S_ChannelShopper_pipe], which of the following motivated you to make that purchase?
checkbox.row: I was directed to buy it via a “buy-now” button on social media
I saw a recommendation to add to cart on the website (e.g., “You might also like” or “Other people also bought”)
I saw an advertisement/banner while browsing online
I received an online coupon I wanted to use
I saw some external pain relief products displayed at the end of an aisle
I saw or became aware of an in-store sale/promotion
I received a store coupon I wanted to use in-store
It was on my shopping list
I wanted to stock up on products for when the need might arise
I read an article recommending a product
I received a recommendation from my doctor
I wanted to find an alternative product to what I have been using
I had run out of the product I was using
I received a recommendation from my friend or family member

checkbox.label: Q_SHOP8
checkbox.title: What issues have you experienced while shopping for external pain relief you purchased at a retailer [pipe:S_ChannelShopper_pipe]?
checkbox.row: Issues using filters to get to the right product online
Issues searching for what I need
Not able to receive it in time/ delivery not quick enough
Items are more expensive online vs in store
Only available behind the counter from a pharmacist
Issues finding what I need in-store

radio.label: Q_Important_Factor
radio.title: What is the most important factor on a product page that you look for?

radio.label: Q_TWOTRIPS
radio.title: Thinking about when you have purchased external pain relief products at a retailer online and picked it up in-store or curbside, which of the following have you ever done?
radio.row: Picked up the external pain relief products and immediately left the store/curbside area
Picked up the external pain relief products and continued to browse for other products/categories in-store
Picked up the external pain relief products and then continued to browse external pain relief products in-store

survey.html: Now, just a few questions for classification purposes…

text.label: C_ZipCode
text.title: Please enter your 5-digit zip code.

select.label: S_Standard_Education
select.title: What is the last level of education that you completed?

radio.label: C_STANDARD_ETHNICITY
radio.title: Which of the following best describes your ethnicity?
